title-part.text: PROCESSES FOR APPLYING FLUENT MATERIALS TO SURFACES, IN GENERAL

reference.text: conveying articles or workpieces through baths of liquid B65G, e.g. B65G49/02

note.note-paragraph: This subclass covers: processes for applying liquids or other fluent materials to a surface or part of a surface, in general, by any mechanical or physical method and particularly processes producing a uniform distribution of liquids or other fluent materials on a surface; pretreatment of surfaces to which liquids or other fluent materials are to be applied; after-treatment of applied coatings.
Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of class B05.
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Processes for applying liquids or other fluent materials

CPC-specific-text.text: using gas close to its critical state

title-part.text: involving the use of an electrostatic field
substances to be applied floating on a fluid
performed by applying the liquid or other fluent material from an outlet device in contact with, or almost in contact with, the surface
performed by transfer from the surfaces of elements carrying the liquid or other fluent material, e.g. brushes, pads, rollers

CPC-specific-text.text: Transferring monomolecular layers or solutions of molecules adapted for forming monomolecular layers from carrying elements
using a temporary backing to which the coating has been applied

title-part.text: performed by gravity only, i.e. flow coating
using means for protecting parts of a surface not to be coated, e.g. using stencils, resists

CPC-specific-text.text: Masking layer made of peelable film
Masking layer made of washable film

title-part.text: Applying different liquids or other fluent materials simultaneously
Successively applying liquids or other fluent materials, e.g. without intermediate treatment
Distributing applied liquids or other fluent materials by members moving relatively to surface

CPC-specific-text.text: Deposition of organic layers from vapour phase

reference.text: vapour phase deposition in general C23C14/00, C23C16/00
plasma deposition in general C23C14/00, C23C16/00

title-part.text: Pretreatment of surfaces to which liquids or other fluent materials are to be applied
After-treatment of applied coatings, e.g. intermediate treating of an applied coating preparatory to subsequent applications of liquids or other fluent materials

reference.text: successively applying liquids or other fluent materials B05D1/36; drying ovens F26B

CPC-specific-text.text: Pretreatment for allowing a non-conductive substrate to be electrostatically coated
Directing or stopping the fluid to be coated with air
the gas being a reactive gas
the gas being a non-reacting gas
Operating the coating or treatment in a controlled atmosphere
involving also the use of a gas
involving also the use of a gas
affecting the surface properties of the coating

title-part.text: Processes for applying liquids or other fluent materials to surfaces to obtain special surface effects, finishes or structures
to obtain a matt or rough surface
to obtain a surface receptive to ink or other liquid
to obtain multicolour or other optical effects

CPC-specific-text.text: having colour interferences or colour shifts or opalescent looking, flip-flop, two tones

title-part.text: to obtain an anti-friction or anti-adhesive surface

reference.text: rendering particulate materials free-flowing in general, e.g. making them hydrophobic B01J2/30

title-part.text: to obtain a coating with specific electrical properties
Processes, other than flocking, specially adapted for applying liquids or other fluent materials to particular surfaces or for applying particular liquids or other fluent materials

reference.text: coating of foodstuffs A23P20/17, A23P20/15, A23P20/18
treatment or coating of shaped articles made of macromolecular substances C08J7/00

title-part.text: to surfaces of films or sheets

reference.text: producing layered products by applying coatings of pasty or pulverulent plastics B29C41/00
chemical treatment of leather C14C; dyeing leather D06P
involving a chemical reaction between the metal and the coating C23
processes for coating the interior of pipes B05D7/222

CPC-specific-text.text: using epoxy-polyolefin systems in mono- or multilayers

title-part.text: to internal surfaces, e.g. of tubes

CPC-specific-text.text: of containers, cans or the like

title-part.text: for applying particular liquids or other fluent materials

note.note-paragraph: A possible inorganic pretreatment or coating on the substrate such as chromatation, phosphatation, plating, is not counted as a layer. This group covers mostly multilayers characterised by each layer and the succession of them (laminates in general B32B)

CPC-specific-text.text: One specific pretreatment, e.g. phosphatation, chromatation, in combination with one specific coating

reference.text: pretreatment of metallic substrates C23C; pretreatment before coating in general B05D3/00

CPC-specific-text.text: Base coat plus clear coat type
the two layers being cured or baked together, i.e. wet on wet
the two layers being applied simultaneously
the first layer being let to dry at least partially before applying the second layer
each layer being cured, at least partially, separately
No curing step for the last layer
No curing step for any layer
the two layers being applied simultaneously
the two layers being cured or baked together
the two layers being applied simultaneously
the first layer is let to dry at least partially before applying the second layer
each layer being cured, at least partially, separately
No curing step for the last layer
No curing step for any layer
the two layers being applied simultaneously
the last layer being a clear coat
all layers being cured or baked together
at least some layers being let to dry at least partially before applying the next layer
each layer being cured, at least partially, separately
some layers being coated "wet-on-wet", the others not
No curing step for the last layer
No curing step for any layer
all layers being cured or baked together
at least some layers being let to dry, at least partially, before applying the next layer
each layer being cured, at least partially, separately
some layers being coated "wet-on-wet", the others not
No curing step for the last layer
No curing step for any layer

based on refractory metals (Ti, V, Cr, Zr, Nb, Mo, Hf, Ta, W)

Phosphates, phosphoric acid or organic salts thereof

Additives other than fillers present in the coating material or in the coating bath

the coating being applied in other forms than involving eliminable solvent, diluent or dispersant
applied as mixtures of monomers and polymers
applied as vapours polymerising in situ

note.note-paragraph: A process should be classified or coded in B05D1/60 or B05D1/62

title-part.text: where the carrier is not clearly specified
where organic solvent or water can be used as alternative
at least one component of the composition being in supercritical state or close to supercritical state

Type of carrier, type of coating (Multilayers)
compositions varying with a gradient perpendicular to the surface

Indexation scheme for the composition of layers

note.note-paragraph: L05D5**/** codes may be combined with one or more codes of the series B05D2400/00 with a + sign. Example : B05D2503/00 + B05D2420/01 + B05D2420/02

title-part.text: Type of polymer or polymer coating
used for pigmentation effect, e.g. metallic effect
Coatings being able to withstand changes in the shape of the substrate or to withstand welding
withstanding draw and redraw process, punching
